comment: Not a bad professor, maybe a little vague but a pretty okay lab professor you just might have to ask for help at times.

Only giving a 2 bc she was nice. Toughest grader I have ever had in my entire school career. Would take off points for the most simple things. We did an experiment where we were supposed to put if the chemicals melted or not, and some of mine didn't melt, and she took points off bc they were apparently supposed to melt. Won't be an easy A for sure.

Please do not take her if you want to have a helpful teacher. She does not seem to know this lab content whatsoever. Any time you had a question for her about the lab report sheet, she did not know the answer right away. Avoid her if you can!

I did not enjoy having Dr. Diatta as a lab professor. She is very vague when you ask her questions about the lab and so is her TA. She grades really hard and it is almost impossible to make a B or higher on the lab reports. Do not recommend taking this professor for labs. You will not make an A!

Very hard grader. Will grade you on every little thing and take off points. Also, she does not seem to have a great idea of what every lab is supposed to result in. There were many times where she did not know how to answer a question and it really affected the post-lab.

The absolute most unreasonable grader I have ever had in my entire school career. She takes off points for the absolute most simple mistakes that do not affect the calculations in any sort of way and simply has no good reason for it. If this is the only lab professor that is available to you, just wait to take lab until the next semester.

Takes off points for the most inconsequential things. I've had to argue for my grade just because if something isn't written exactly the way she wants you to write it, you get points taken off, even if it's correct. Unclear instructions on just about everything she assigns but you better do it exactly how she wants it. 

DO NOT TAKE!!!

She barely explains what's expected in her lab notebook. If you don't understand something you better pray the SI does. She grades everything to an extreme degree; I found myself spending 6-8 hours a week on reports just to fail. I had a 99 in my chem lecture and barely pulled out a C. Good luck if this is the only lab left.

This is not a 1 credit class, it's more like 4. The professor was fine, seemed knowledgeable enough. But the class itself is one of the worst I've taken. Get ready to hand-write upwards of 20 pages of lab notebooks per week, only to get low C's on them for minor errors. Stay away from this class as long as you can, it's worse than Calc II.

She expects a lot from a 1 credit course. Grades lab reports in way too much detail so you will lose points even if you give a response you thought was correct but didn't meet her criteria. Wastes a lot of time in lab going over the lecture theory before you can start. Lab notebooks are mandatory and will take you a while to do for the prelab.

Diane Diatta was a fairly average professor. With COVID we would have one class in person and one online, and our coursework would be done entirely through Labflow. She was helpful whenever I had to email her, but wasn't always the best at explaining the experiments. We once talked in circles trying to explain the same exact thing to one another.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took her for Chem Lab over the summer, and maybe because it was online but she was the easiest teacher ever. We did all the "lab experiments" online, if you had a question and emailed her at 12 am she'd respond. She was extremely lenient on due dates, and such an easy grader, she'd work a problem out exactly for you if you asked. I loved her.

There are 6 different categories that affect your final grade and this is only a 1 credit general education lab. It requires more work than the 3 credit lecture itself. She digs into detail to find the smallest mistake to deduct points. If you come in 15 minutes late, she doesn't let you in and that day is 0 even if you turn in the best work ever.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Teaching was the worst decision she ever made. Makes u read 5-10 page procedures and summarize it in a notebook before the lab. If she doesn't like ur 4-page summary, she won't let u in. Took of points just because I didn't EXPECT that a 5 point question would need multiple answers in a sheet with 3 and 5 point questions! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She is a very nice person, and first impressions are good. However there's a lot of writing in a strictly monitored lab notebook. In the first real lab I got in a small argument with her over the procedure for that lab, where the demonstrated a clear lack of knowledge of physics, and understanding of what the lab was. Might drop this class.

Please don't take guys. She's is ridiculously hard. Grades very harshly. Our class always argues our grades but she doesn't care. She explains the lab for an hour and a half, then doesn't understand why we sometimes don't have enough time to finish the lab and you can't leave until your WHOLE notebook is filled out, even if you finish the lab.
